To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFro=
m: bulletbabea@...: Wed, 30 Jan 2008 20:55:01 -0800Subject: RE: [=
EVP-ITC] Re: **Special Notice Regaurding Your Group Membership**





Hiya =
Bruce
 
You just post your files to the esnips account. Then if you want pe=
ople to get special notices you can add them as members by email or add as =
friends thru esnips. Make the folders/files public access and its open to t=
he esnips community (theres quite a few over there) as well as the group fo=
rum here. You just say here you posted your files same as you always do and=
 give the link and they can go and check them out even if its a 50 meg file=
. 
It's pretty cool and it has alot of options. We use it to post ITC pictu=
res and share big EVP collections or just keep up with some of the massive =
amount of results each other gets. 
 
Its better than alot of pay services =
Ive seen, and the fact that its free just makes it that much better. Alot o=
f people are not computer saavy. But I simply email them the link, and when=
 they click on it and visit my gallery or whatever I have set up for them t=
o view, they automatically just verified thier email account is real. So th=
en when they decide to join the signup is instant and they can begin the pr=
ocess of uploading immediately. It makes it so much easier for them to figu=
re out how to do things.
 
Your folder options are endless. You can make on=
e for each box, and then make subfolders that are dated in each one. It all=
ows descriptions or comments for each file.
 
I used it to highlight differ=
ent methods of recording and I didnt even come close to covering them all. =
This group has alot of methods going on, we just need more file space to sh=
are them. You will figure it out, just make a public folder, upload a coupl=
e files, and send us a link. It tells you what the link is for the folder a=
nd even allows you to change it if you wish.
 
Mistybruce halliday <paranor=
malinvestigating@...> wrote:


Misty,I opened an esnips account wha=
t do you do to get the files to the group? bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-=
ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: bulletbabea@...: Wed, 30 Jan 2008 10:06:=
21 -0800Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: **Special Notice Regaurding Your Group M=
embership**



Thanks Bruce. My wish is that we had unlimited posting/filin=
g space. But til then we will have to make do with what we have. Try the es=
nips thing out several of us are already over there forming our lil communi=
ty for file sharing. With 50 gigs you can pretty much post in whatever form=
at you like which is what we do. Some files are just too large to post here=
 or too many of them to post all at once so we just use that instead.
 
Plu=
s its easy to link up with others so that they get notifications you have u=
ploaded a new file. I think for now its a great way to expand our group and=
 possibly even reach more people who havent joined here or even heard of th=
e things we do. It also keeps a hit count for how many people visit your fo=
lders so you can see what people are listening to. And it allows comments s=
o that visitors can give feedback if they wish.
 
Mistybruce halliday <para=
normalinvestigating@...> wrote:


Misty, Your wish is my command. I=
 will convert to mp3from now on. bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoog=
roups.comFrom: bulletbabea@...: Wed, 30 Jan 2008 17:13:53 +0000Su=
bject: [EVP-ITC] Re: **Special Notice Regaurding Your Group Membership**


=
Yep I agree with a few files there is some loss in conversion. Thats why I =
sent out that program because it has next to no loss in the conversion. But=
 again I will say I would rather post 1 meg of files than take up the entir=
e groups space by posting 15 megs of files. When I want to share more compl=
ete audio I just use my esnips.com account to do that. It is just as easy f=
or people to click on my esnips hotlink in a notification post as it is to =
click on the files link to the left.You are right we just have to manage ou=
rselves better.Misty--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday <paranor=
malinvestigating@...> wrote:>> > I post in wav. format I believe when you c=
onvert the file from wav to mp3.> certain aspects of the file are lost. If =
an mp3. file is a tenth of the size of> a wav. file where does the other 9/=

 every nuance in a box file is crucial for the > correct interpretation of =
the file, sometimes the a word created by the entity is not only> comprised=
 of radio fragment but also static noise mixed with the fragments of radio =
vocal> to form the message the entity wishes to leave. I don't know the tec=
hnical aspects of the file > change but I think it's common sense that when=
 you try to pour a gallon of water into a shot glass> all you wind up with =
is a shot glass full of water the rest is spilled and lost.> > I keep my fi=
les posted for 5 or less days, just long enough for anyone that wants to li=
sten can.> If your going to leave your files posted indefinitely and keep a=
dding to the folder then of course it will> put pressure on the storage spa=
ce.> > As far as posting a notice for every file, some of us may wish to li=
sten from their e-mail or not > have to go to the file section to listen, T=
hat's probably why that option is given.> If I didn't like the notices clut=
tering up my e-mail in box you can change that feature in the group> member=
ship options. So if anyone does not want that feature they can turn it off =
and only read posts on the group.> > It's not the lack of space is the mism=
anagement of it by all of us. > when I change my files from wav. to mp3 I h=
ear a distinct difference, do it in an audio editor and you can visually se=
e the difference.> > Bruce> Bruce Halliday > > > To: EVP-ITC@...: warrior18=
eii@...: Wed, 30 Jan 2008 05:05:37 -0800Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: **Specia=
l Notice Regaurding Your Group Membership**> > > > > > > That's a great ide=
a Steve and it was mentioned before but either no one noticed Misty's post =
or it was ignored. It would be a shame though if people start loosing files=
 because they are not paying attention to the owners instructions.Regards,F=
rank R.> ----- Original Message ----From: Steve Hultay <urkel23@...>To: EVP=
-ITC@...: Wednesday, January 30, 2008 6:06:23 AMSubject: [EVP-ITC] Re: **Sp=
ecial Notice Regaurding Your Group Membership**> > Misty,I have and idea. O=
ne solution is to post Mp3 files instead of Wav. files or any other format.=
 It seems like the Mp3's sound the same and are only 1/10th of the size. I =
think that would probably clear up 90 percent of the board right there. If =
i actually have more than a couple files from here on out, i will be attach=
ing them to an e-mail and not the board to save space here. And also, if pe=
ople do post files maybe we can all just have one post that says we have up=
loaded files to our folder instead of 30 audio announcements in a row that =
just seems to waste a lot of e-mail space in the individual e-mails. And it=
 also pushes the current topic on the board to another page and is lost for=
 those who wanted to share. Just my thoughts on helping the subject. I know=
 we are all excited, but misty is right. I went to add a file the other day=
 and the group was at 93 percent capacity, so it won't be long before we ru=
n out of space.-Steve H.--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, "Misty" <bulletbab=
ea@ ...> wrote:>> Just a little friendly reminder that you all need to orga=
nize your > files better in the files area. Space is limited here and you a=
re all > nearing the 100% mark so try to keep your section under 5 megs. If=
 > you need more space use www.esnips.com and you can store 50 gigs to > sh=
are with the group or public.> > I think it is great you guys have so much =
to share I just wish that > our yahoo group wasnt so limited on space (and =
that I wasnt so > limited on time). But I have found a way around it. If ju=
st a few > people signed up and shared using esnips they can invite others =
to > visit thier files and once they do they also get 50 gigs of free > spa=
ce for audio pictures or video or whatever you want to post.> > I was consi=
dering setting up one "group" account to start with and > inviting all memb=
ers who post files to join it and be able to post to > the account. It will=
 automatically notify everyone thats a member > when a file is added to it =
just like the yahoo group does. It also > allows you to share with the publ=
ic or privately if you so choose. > You can even allow your friends to post=
 to your account if you wish.> > This group has grown and expanded and we j=
ust need to make a few > changes to how we do things to keep it running mor=
e smoothly for the > future. I am hoping that you all will help me in this =
endeavor. I > know many of you have already adapted the idea to help us org=
anize > and maintain the group.> > I want you to keep sharing and to be abl=
e to share more! > > So please organize and not post stray files that are t=
argets for > deletion once the que is 100% full. And for your own sake, if =
no one > elses, be respectful to each other.> > MD>> > Be a better friend, =
